tasks.task: Demonstrate pruning an apple tree in late March/early spring.
subtasks: Gather the necessary tools (pruners, big lopper, Swedish saw).
Assess the tree's canopy and identify branches to remove.
Remove tall branches to reduce tree height.
Eliminate crossing branches to prevent rubbing and wounds.
Thin out inner branches for better air circulation.
Make cuts close to the branch collar to promote healing.

tasks.task: Explain pruning benefits for disease prevention and tree health.
subtasks: Discuss reducing disease spread through proper pruning timing.
Mention concerns with fire blight and affected tree varieties.
Highlight the importance of maintaining open canopies for airflow.
Show correct cutting methods near branch collars.
Illustrate thinning cuts versus heading cuts.
Explain the goal of training lateral branches.
Provide examples of past pruning efforts on the tree.

tasks.task: Discuss the process of gradually pruning a tree.
subtasks: Emphasize the importance of annual pruning rather than excessive cuts in one year.
Mention the advisory to not remove more than 25% of branches annually.
